content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    julia_code_block = r"```julia\n([^\n]*\n)*?```"m

    # Use a regular expression search and replace to remove the code fences
    cleaned_content = replace(md, julia_code_block => s"\1")

    # Split on newlines to get each code block as a separate string
    code_blocks = split(cleaned_content, "\n\n")

    # Join the code blocks together with a newline
    joined_code = join(code_blocks, "\n")

    return joined_code
end
```

This function defines a regular expression to match Julia code blocks, removes the code fences, and then joins the resulting code blocks together with a newline.
